question.text: Which of the following does not show similarity between boron and aluminium?

options.text: Both from oxides of type <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> when heated with oxygen at high temperature
Both dissolve in alkalies and evolve hydrogen
Hydroxides of both the elements are basic in nature
Both form nitrides of MN type when heated with <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

solution.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><msub><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> is a weak monobasic Lewis acid while <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><msub><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> in amphoteric substance i.e. it can reacts with acid and base both.
